intro: Sebastiania salicifolia var. similis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces distinctive orange to red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. This variant is closely related to other species within the Sebastiania genus, sharing similar morphological traits.
